title: foundry binaries that the nix overlay relies on are getting rugged
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

_No response_

### What command(s) is the bug in?

_No response_

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

There is discussion on the nix overlay

https://github.com/shazow/foundry.nix/issues/31#issuecomment-1879751727

I don't know how the linked repository works and there is really not enough context for me to resolve this issue. What is the issue exactly? Are you trying to download old nightlies? Nightlies are purged after a while, we only keep a few around.

We're running into the same thing too after recently updating our pinned nightly version in CI. And these are very recent versions.

Examples of ones that poofed:
- https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/releases/tag/nightly-6fc74638b797b8e109452d3df8e26758f86f31fe
- https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/releases/tag/nightly-02292f2d2caa547968bd039c06dc53d98b72bf39

Do you have recommendations on the latest stable version we can use that won't be purged?

![Screenshot 2024-01-10 at 10 22 28](https://uploads.linear.app/f2544f8c-2bdf-42c2-a891-97db14e1d6ff/36a44211-8e1f-4d4f-a483-fff9a79f5d4d/43c667da-6246-4b81-9565-8eb6030805cc?signature=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJwYXRoIjoiL2YyNTQ0ZjhjLTJiZGYtNDJjMi1hODkxLTk3ZGIxNGUxZDZmZi8zNmE0NDIxMS04ZTFmLTRkNGYtYTQ4My1mZmY5YTc5ZjVkNGQvNDNjNjY3ZGEtNjI0Ni00YjgxLTk1NjUtOGViNjAzMDgwNWNjIiwiaWF0IjoxNzA1MDc4MzgyLCJleHAiOjMzMjc1NjM4MzgyfQ.b6WD6KAEjJ2rgnUVPNWhsODOVvokBHJxF56wcEtstbc "=696x")

@onbjerg context from TG, yes we need versions of binaries that we pin to remain existant

Looks like the "permanent" monthly releases are getting wiped (the first nightly release of each month is supposed to be retained). Reference PR: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/pull/3888

Need to investigate what changed. 

![image](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/6292/6f3bfa0a-c3cc-4ee3-9441-85df7bd7d56a)

Can see her Dec 1-10 are missing.
cc @hellwolf, since you did the work last time (thank you again!), in case you wanted to take a peek.

I think this is the issue:

https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/blob/b0e70ba7401d120701de10dee2b09d4e55c7354e/.github/scripts/prune-prereleases.js#L16-L17

If the first of the month release gets nuked or missed, then a new release is never retained.

Yes, that script is responsible for pruning nightly releases so they don't stick around. Otherwise we'd have over 700 releases at this point 😄 The releases will continue to get purged until we release a stable, but I do see the reasoning in keeping around some "monthly nightlies". The script above should be adjusted accordingly

Hey folks, I could have a look asap.

P.S. I did notice this week that the https://github.com/shazow/foundry.nix monthly was broken this week.

@hellwolf Much appreciated!

I'm semi-AFK the next several days but happy to review PRs too. @thedavidmeister also said he'll be able to contribute some time this weekend if it's not resolved already. :)
@onbjerg what would be the problem with over 700 releases?

@shazow @hellwolf https://github.com/shazow/foundry.nix/pull/32

Here's a PR that sets the github node id for the "version" rather than a hardcoded `0.0.0` so maybe that helps with the hash corruption issue (which is not the 404 issue, but it certainly exacerbates the situation)

@shazow @onbjerg @hellwolf So looks like the tags that are `nightly-` are mutable and non-deterministic? This release was 20 hours ago, i ran the overlay update script 19 hours ago to pick up all the assets, then all the assets changed 6 hours ago and the derivation is now corrupted because the sha of the assets doesn't match. Why are the assets being replaced on hash-tagged releases?

https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/pull/6789 here's a PR that includes the timestamp in the nightly release tag

rust builds are not deterministic so if two release jobs ever run for the same github sha then currently the releases will collide and the assets will be rebuilt, and anyone downstream that is checking the hash of the releases will see it as a corrupt release

@shazow  I also noticed that the monthly action starts to run every month:

https://github.com/shazow/foundry.nix/actions/workflows/update-foundry-bin-monthly.yml
Here is a fix for the pruning script: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/pull/6806

> @shazow I also noticed that the monthly action starts to run every month:
> 
> https://github.com/shazow/foundry.nix/actions/workflows/update-foundry-bin-monthly.yml

The monthly action runs daily now, since it was made to be idempotent.

> > @shazow I also noticed that the monthly action starts to run every month:
> > https://github.com/shazow/foundry.nix/actions/workflows/update-foundry-bin-monthly.yml
> 
> The monthly action runs daily now, since it was made to be idempotent.

Okay, that makes sense. It added stronger requirement to the pruning script for sure, which I think the PR #6806 should have fixed.

Fwiw, this is the kept jan release: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/releases/tag/nightly-293fad73670b7b59ca901c7f2105bf7a29165a90

See the action log: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/actions/runs/7549154872/job/20553972614
